GBmXuLMW8vdxL-j8VRbmZg.text: Okay, so the pizza was not amazing, but I was too excited that they made whole wheat crust and delivered that I didn't care. The delivery guy was pretty fast and very nice. This place is very cheap, which is nice if you're in college!

UvImzTGXGNh7TdiB-u_hCA.text: Pros: -Fast delivery within Squirrel Hill -Moderate prices -Fairly diverse menu (does not have regular omissions typical to Squirrel Hill Pizza shops) -Several healthier options available on menu -Discounts and coupons galore -Online ordering is quick and easy Cons: -Drinks forgotten on order (very common for delivery orders) -Pizza is alright but not "good' -Hoagies/subs are pretty bad (cheap bread, very little cheese & rubberized meat) -Deserts come frozen with the wax paper included -Fries very tasty but pretty soggy as well. -Foreign delivery driver may have difficulty with delivery instructions. While this is still a new establishment, given the amount of direct competition in the immediate area I would have expected better. The delivery time for my order was truly excellent but in their haste they disregarded my drink order. The Driver did return however within several minutes after being chased down, but the drink he returned with was still a variation on my drink order. I would say that the quality of the food is OK, not incredibly good but certainly not the worse pizza in town. Also, their personal pizza options and late night delivery option make it an attractive choice for delivery. On my order the desert arrived mostly frozen and still wrapped in it's original freezer wax paper. Also the fries were placed in Styrofoam which makes them soggy. There are 3 types of Pizza Shops in Squirrel Hill: -Specialty (Mineo's, Aiello's, Napoli's, Lucci's) -Big Chain (Vocelli, Domino's, Pizza Hut) -Budget (Amier, Rialto, Italian Village, Bellino) Pizza Bellino definitely belongs to the later category. For me, when judging a Squirrel Hill budget pizza shop, I always use Pizza Amier as a comparison standard (since their prices are the lowest in the neighborhood). Are they more or less expensive then Pizza Amier? Does their product taste better than Amier? Does the taste justify the cost? While they do offer a tasty product and some more diverse menu options than Amier, I do not feel that the taste justifies the cost in this instance. I would not recommend this Pizza Shop. However, if had no other option I wouldn't consider it out of the question either.

nPZ5XDSdH1BcDEQ8ozJjbA.text: Twice now I've had horrible experience. The first I got a cold pizza 3 hours after I ordered. But I gave them another shot. This time the canceled my order two hours after I ordered and ten minutes after grub hub said it was out for delivery. When I called, they yelled at me straight away and said it was my fault for ordering. Never again

QDJNLxYjk5IEyYNUNl2vow.text: Great pizza!! I have been searching for a good pizza place in pittsburgh forever and this place is awesome! Best pizza I've had in the city. My favorite is the sausage and onion pizza :)

nvIKRPtguxcJMFSD7UutSA.text: I used to like this pizza place.  Their regular pizza's are decent.  There are much better options in the area.  However, for the price and quality, this is a good deal.  Their specialty pizza's aren't so great and aren't worth the price.  The problem I have with this place is the drivers (one specifically) who found it necessary to comment while checking out my girlfriend.  I don't care for any sexist pigs to deliver my pizza, so you can be sure I'll never order from this place again.  Lucci's has just as good of prices with just as good of pizza and faster delivery time.  Mineo's is still the best in the area.  Just based on principle, you should avoid this place.  Unless you like being oogled and have sexist remarks made to you when you're trying to simply order a pizza.

H5lrvAlOFF_a39fEwsxT8Q.text: For our first pizza since moving to Pittsburgh, we wanted something simple and inexpensive.  We'll try the Aiello's and Mineo's later I'm sure, but we were just looking for something standard to curb the pizza craving.  Found a coupon in the mail for a $15.99 combo at Pizza Bellino - a large pizza and 12 wings.  Sold.  I called to place the order, and whoever answered the phone was a bit disorganized.  When he asked to put me "on hold," he clearly just put the receiver down on the counter because I could still hear him yelling at someone and then taking an order from an in-person customer.  I felt like a moron because I kept thinking he was talking to me!  Also, after I ordered, he did not take my name or any personal information.  I know it was pick-up, not delivery, but um - shouldn't you get my name?  I tried to ask if he wanted my name but he'd already hung up.  Stellar first impression!  Not.  (haha. I said "Not."  I'm eight years old.)  SO we mosey down the street 20 minutes later for our pizza.  Seeing as he didn't have my name, the dude tried to give me a pepperoni pizza with wings, and then we had a brief and confusing verbal exchange where I said I didn't order pepperoni, but I'd take it if they made it by mistake - as long as I didn't have to pay more than the coupon price.  The guy did not seem keen on that idea, but then suddenly he had an epiphany - perhaps there was another pizza in the back - the one I'd actually ordered!  Revelation!  And that was what happened.  At home, we opened up our boxes, ready to chow down.  The pizza was utterly, totally "fine."  It was okay.  It was standard.  It was pizza.  Cheese wasn't oozingly melty, there wasn't a luscious smear of homemade sauce, and the crust didn't have those hand-tossed bumps and crevices.  It was college student pizza.  Totally standard, totally satisfying.  The wings were actually a step above - lots of meat on them, and the sauce was pretty hot!  Lips and tongue definitely tingling for the rest of the evening.  And of course, cheap (with a coupon at least!)  I'd get pizza here again - especially if I was ordering for a crowd or a sporting event and didn't want any really gourmet or expensive pizza.  It's probably good drunk pizza too.  The wings I'd definitely order again as well.  It's totally fine pizza, as long as you know what you're getting into.  If you want something above average, look elsewhere.  If you just want crust, cheese, and sauce - this will satisfy your cravings.

grqaU663aYiwlHP6Nbqw0w.text: I had ordered a pizza for the NFC championship game. I understand you could be busy but my order was cold and the cheese had dried out. Unacceptable.

7nz3mhk0_cw8VXGvgE33Cg.text: This is the best pizza in Squirrel Hill, IMO. Good crust, quality ingredients, nice sauce (not too much, not too thick, not too sweet), well spiced. It is not quite New York style, but it is a thin crust pizza. I particularly like the Bellino Pie - which also has a good amount of smoky bacon on it. Another wonderful pizza, if you like white pizza, is the Mediterranean pie. It has feta, black olives, artichokes, tomatoes - with a nice light grilled, fresh and flavorful taste. If you don't care for the super cheesy Mineo's, and want something more flavorful than Aiello's, Pizza Bellino's is the place to go in Squirrel Hill. Very good, fresh salads, as well, and I would also recommend trying their specialty pastas

Q4IlTSTo9L8fr-KcsSQiqA.text: Fast delivery. 1 start for that.  But otherwise....seriously pittsburgh yelpers?!?!?! You have guided me to yet another disappointing meal.  This is NOT good pizza. If you want something fast, go for it. If you want some pizza, don't.

dI5ZQCwyBUNUkvghcASXVA.text: Terrible service, rude employees.....I can't comment on the food because after we were told it was on its way the order was cancelled.  If their food is anything like their customer service I'm sure it's pure excrement.....

sFmxDtvtsEgP1iV5gjv-pA.text: Ok. So. On GrubHub their hours are wrong. I order at 1:30am on a Saturday night (which appears to be within their hours of business). So I waited and waited and waited until 3:15am when I finally got a call from grubhub saying they were closed and our order was canceled... Of course EVERYTHING else was closed at that time. So I'm sitting here pizzaless, and SUPER bummed I wasn't able to reorder when I found out they were closed... DONT ORDER AFTER MIDNIGHT OR BE DISAPPOINTED / PIZZALESS

htq01FVrji4eTD5KTBcZmg.text: I recently did a pizza crawl through squirrel hill with a friend, where we hit every single one of squirrel hill's 7 pizzerias, and got a slice of pepperoni pizza at each one in a row!  Pizza Bellino was a surprise for us.  It's new and right by the library, neither of us had ever been inside before.  Turns out, it's got some of the best overall pizza in squirrel hill!  While it didn't especially stand out in any one area, everything about it was good and nothing about it was weak, Good sauce, cheese, pepperoni, cheap, fast, and they put extra cheese on top of the pepperoni which no other pizzeria did.  Nice touch, and very tasty slice overall!

R7ZhRtdxu2E8z8effRHyiA.text: I didn't want to give this place less than 3 stars since I didn't try the pizza but let me say the salad was not very impressive.  I got the popcorn chicken salad.  It came with a ton of spring mix greens (a la Costco), a handful of fried chicken bits, a bunch of soggy fries (Pittsburgh style, I guess) and a giganto glob of fried cheese on top.  The cheese was so all encompassing that I had to basically remove it and throw it out.  The fries were good but a little too greasy.  Not much else to the salad besides a couple of tomatoes and peppers.  A pretty unsatisfying salad but guess that's what I get for ordering salad from a pizza place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled chicken salad without french fries or cheese
Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Popcorn chicken salad

VLBZhMbjrXTWlymELgOm_g.text: This place has horrible pizza.  I was told by a passerby that they had good pizza here while going to the post office, I'm not sure what this person was thinking.  This is the worst pizza I can remember having, it was overpriced and burnt.  You look at it and know it wouldn't taste good and you aren't wrong.  Go to aiello's, mineo's or order pizza hut lol.

VlWaC-dtcxPXNPc420rc5A.text: I'm surprised by the reviews for here because I've never had a problem with them. As Duchess you probably can guess I'm here a lot and much more than the times I'd remembered to check in. First of all, you have to give them some credit for being the newest pizza joint in a area that already has 6 others. I mean really at that point you know they're either naive or they can offer something better.  So all the reviews from what I can tell are about their pizza. Well they  also have good wraps, awesome calzones, crisp cheese sticks (not soggy like eatnparks) and huge delicious salads! They have a pizza special 2 cheese slices and a drink for $4 which I dare you to compare to Italian Village Pizza just up the street where they have the same deal but thin cardboard pizza slices. If you go for one of Bellino's specialty pizzas, go ahead an compare it to Lucci's which is overpriced "gourmet" pizza that doesn't deliver. When it comes to Mineo's pizza and Aiello's pizza, you've got to know they have been around so long that they have a rivalry between the two, you like one or the other, but it's also completely unfair fight if you try to compare it to Bellino.  The have a clean area with tables to dine in if you choose and the food is served to you quickly. I've only had it slightly burnt once when I went in on a Friday night which is was obvious they were swamped with orders and deliveries to be done. Also when it comes to the phone service, it's always one guy helping you and the customers at the counter. They don't have fancy hold music, he asks you to hold then helps the customer there and then helps you as quickly as he can and in the order you came. He's the same guy there every day except Sunday working his hardest. It's obvious the difference of the pizza on Sundays is lower quality because he's the one that keeps the employees on their toes. I'm giving them 5 stars because for what they offer I think they deserve it. In Pittsburgh, pizza isn't just the same everywhere, you have to pick your pizza place depending on what you want out of it, remember that!!

GXiWZWg9ZERTeNyyIND7RQ.text: I ordered a pizza from them and they sent the wrong pizza and they did not acknowledge or apologize for their error. Probably won't order from them again

Gi9vpjFNZRh4wwnXEyOFoQ.text: Disgusting calzone. Cost 20 bucks. Delivery 20 minutes late. Pizza just okay.

jNMNDHhTZp3ZcXI0IRaH4Q.text: Great, fresh pizza and salad. The house dressing is exactly what you want an italian dressing to be. We ordered deliver on a very cold night and received hot pizza from a very friendly delivery driver. We will be calling back soon and I would recommend this to anyone who likes fresh, thin crust pizza.

Gfir33f2ffH45hQNeXQQqA.text: Fast delivery. They can accommodate requests for thin crust pizza.  But the cheese blend is....too greasy.  Not as bad as Mineo's or Aiello's though.

kBk7I9kafxwFUSNQoDCOSA.text: Ordered food here on a whim while staying in Pittsburgh for two nights.  The food arrived in 45 minutes and was great.  As good as I can imagine or 1am delivery.  Gyro was delicious - filled to the brim with meat and feta with lots of sauce and veggies on the side.

dDw0dgHjmxbup4eP68gW8w.text: The pizza here is great!  They have tons of specialty pizzas to choose from, many have multiple kinds of cheese.  I have tried Mediterannean, Vegetarian, and Artichoke--all were awesome.  The crust is thick and they put salty feta cheese on top.  I think this is my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh so far!!

v8pavbW7QzGJUtlPvRNcjw.text: Consistent, satisfying, New York style pizza by the slice in Squirrel Hill.

38EiaEOR_WWN0uzopp_ASg.text: Horrible order an Italian hoagie, it was soggy and slapped together,brown hot wilted lettuce. I could tell it was made ahead and sat forever. Called tried to get a refund the obtuse individual on the other end was not in sync with what I was trying to say, in the end of it all its a wrap I refuse to spend another dollar at that awful place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soggy and brown lettuce slapped together hoagie.

NZMlbPZ-U23FQoB9AkSiJQ.text: I ordered this last night with a few friends from out of town. They both got calzones which were great, I ordered a chicken parm. I open it up and the whole thing just reeks. I take one bite and it's clear something went bad, most likely the mountain of melted cheese on top. Not a problem, these things totally happen. But when I call up to let them know what happened, not only did he do nothing for me, but made it sound like I was making it all up and there was no way his food could possibly be spoiled! I know I'll never be eating here again, even though the food may have been OK, just because the customer service was so atrocious.

Wblnohpd0AI6SQ-73F8ELQ.text: We really liked this place at first because of their specialty pizzas, which are pretty good, but after awhile, we got tired of them. Also, our stomachs consistently did not feel good the day after.  Also, after being in the area longer, we found that there are other places to get a good hoagie and pizza.  Bellinos though is not bad, I really do recommend trying one of their specialty pies, especially the vegetarian or the mediterranean.

BJxtU91uQ32_AjjI6ccgbg.text: Aweful service, I used foodler to order stuffed shells but there was no place for me to add Italian sausage. The order was $9.99 and since I couldn't add the additional item it did not meet the $10 delivery minimum so I couldn't submit the order. So I added a small pizza with Italian sausage and put in the special instuctruction notes in CAPS not to include the pizza explaining why I ordered that way. I realized I had to go to an appointment on my lunch break so I called to see if it was too late to cancel because of this. Not only had they not read the special instructions and made the full order, didn't let me suggest picking it up or finding a solution the rude man who answered screamed at me I had wasted $20 of food and hung up on me. Needless to say I would never give my money or business to a business that'd be so disrespectful to a customer over a $20 order no less, that they did incorrectly! With that aweful man working there I don't understand how they're still in business but if he keeps it up hopefully it won't be for long.

4KX9exOi2ADr9QDixbJQbA.text: New Years Day and this was the only pizza spot in Squirrel Hill open late. I decided to take a chance on this place... The service was horrible. Then to add insult to injury the pizza was beyond unappetizing. The toppings were dry and over cooked  on the Bellino Pie not to mention the fact that there was barely any cheese or sauce.... Just dry over cooked toppings. We also ordered the chef Bellino pie.... It clearly stated white garlic sauce... There was no sauce at all. Actually, there was dry basil and Plopped Ricotta cheese carelessly placed on this pie. When we tried to call the restaurant to return this $42 monstrosity of an order, they were disgustingly rude and had no intention of making this right. When you pay $42 dollars for 2 lack luster disgusting pies.... A review this size is warranted. If I could give negative 5 stars I would!!!!!

W4rffGn-_pnG8cTIc5xZvA.text: I ordered a plain large cheese pizza through yelp on a Sunday night. It arrived in a little over an hour, and it was cold and the box was crushed. In the past I've had other problems like getting the wrong order delivered to me and then having to wait for them to remake my order and bring it again.

tRPbd1mjFRAO2SxtIsR_7Q.text: I love the food here. I've tried plenty of things on the menu- Grilled chicken feta Greek salad, BYO pizza, chicken tenders and a handful of appetizers. All great! I've gone here twice this week for dinner (for me and my family) and all of us agree it is good food at a good price!

ir4pdtHOoGPA3KbuFmingQ.text: We ordered from here on the fly one late Tuesday night. I was very, very surprised at how fast the food was delivered.   The pepperoni pizza was perfect. For me the crust makes/breaks a pie and theirs was spot on. It had really deep flavor and was perfect for dipping in hot sauce. The sauce was hearty and not that odd sweet flavor some places use.  My girlfriend only eats cheese pizza. Hers was very cheesy and she said she love it. We finally found our regular place. Can't wait to try their other foods.

jnV7hgWpByZcTZ5GQHpHRw.text: Very delicious pizza. Have gyros too. They have a nice atmosphere and a tv with the news playing. Owner by an Italian family. If your in Squirrel Hill, looking for pizza, look no further.

vhrxuSmJv1IMb2Aw_ZJFsw.text: Ordered a cheesesteak hoagie it was not made with steak. It was gyro meat or rotten. Called and the man I spoke with just yelled at me telling me I don't know what I'm talking about.  That's  funny.  I  work at a restaurant.  I will NEVER order from them again. I will make sure to let my family and friends know about the terrible food and customer service! !!!!!!

OdEkFM6oQC4BMXEHvetDsA.text: Went here with friends from work who, as well as ordering food along with me, brought something additional to eat with them. The man behind the counter not only told them to leave. He used a lot of profanity while doing so. Calling them "f***ing a*******s" repeatedly. His coworkers expressed that they disagreed with his handling of the situation. But he is apparently in charge. I'll never return here.

BWar24-qBVax8wj6tcqXaQ.text: I just ordered delivery from here via GrubHub, and I'm pretty satisfied!! I ordered a steak salad with a somewhat lengthy amount of modifications, and I also ordered the potato bacon soup. I'm very pleased with the salad! All of my weird modifications were met, which I am very thankful for :) The soup is tasty, maybe not as thick as I thought it would be, but still yummy to dip my garlic bread in! Delivery was prompt, no issues finding my house. Overall, A+! Would order again and recommend to a friend!

I0YSGOjlAsbh4HUW5-2POw.text: This is by far the best pizza I have had in a while.   I used to order from Italian village pizza,  but their pizza has gone down hill and sucks lately.... my cousin said to try this place and not only is their menu amazing, but the food is really really good!

fO4FsVVOue5B0pPCZW9IYg.text: Let me start by saying that I am a New Yorker (before Pittsburgh, I lived in Manhattan for 8 years and Long Island before that), and we can be very picky about our pizza. The dough should be thin enough where it's crunchy, but not so thin that when you pick up the pizza, it flaps down. The sauce should be just a bit acidic, but no so much that it tastes like vinegar. And the cheese should be plentiful enough to give pizza that characteristic flavor, but not so plentiful that you get a glob of fat in your mouth.  Well, after trying a whole host of pizza joints in the 'burgh, I'm happy to say that Pizza Bellino is my favorite. Now, this isn't going to be authentic NY pizza, but it will pretty close. Every time I crave a slice, this is the first place that comes to mind. In fact, but for their $11 minimum order for delivery, I would have some on the way right now!   If you want a classic pizza without any frills, Pizza Belino will do the job.  (and stay away from those terrible "Pittsburgh Pizzas" at Aiello's and Mineo's ...bleh)

KOgpYEFlbnNxW4FhiO1ACA.text: Favorite place to order pizza delivery!   Never actually eaten in the store, but have ordered from them many many times. I love private owned pizza shops, I think they just overall taste so much better than chain-store pizzas.   Delivery is always made within a reasonable amount of time, and pizza's consistently delicious. Not too expensive either.   Also ordered gyros and spaghetti w/ meatballs from Bellino's before. HUGE portions!! and tasty too!   Next time you crave some pizza, skip Domino's or Vocelli's check out Bellino's. It may surprise you!

SD8ZhI8SHc42Chk5BYW-3g.text: Pizza Bellino has been our go-to place for a vegetable pie ever since we first tried it. There's a good balance between the crust, sauce, cheese, and toppings, with none of them being overwhelming and all of them having the same high quality. It's been a consistently great pizza over the years, and none of the other pizza joints we've tried around here have been able to better it. The pick-up service is good and it's a nice little place without many frills. Highly recommended if you like a well-balanced pizza with a good mix of toppings.

g-jvrCcMgwLZ08EdXhpX8Q.text: I love all italian food.. From pasta to pizza to anything with cheese, pepperoni & sauce. & generally speaking, I'm not terribly picky when it comes to food. Last night, my boyfriend and I got a to-go calzone, their 5 cheese calzone, to be exact. The bread was over cooked, none of the five cheeses were melted.. even after we microwaved it ourselves (though the bread was still hot.) Next time I come to pittsburgh, I will never even think of ordering from this business.

txG6jK_VhZCU6Nr126wFNA.text: Had a chance to eat there, and I must say that while I have eaten at pizza places that were worse, I have also eaten at several places that were far far better.  In my opinion it is over priced and some of the food tasted 'out of a box' not freshly made. My wife ordered a small pizza and it left much to be desired. It tasted more like cardboard than pizza. My sons chicken tenders where okay. I mean how can you ruin chicken tenders. The cheese sticks went fast. My boyZ collapsed on them. So that's a good sign. While the service was okay, and the establishment clean , there just seemed to be something missing. The tables had no condiments, salt pepper etcetera.  No napkins and or silverware. Finally they do not offer fountain drinks. We (a family of four) were forced to by one two liter soda as opposed to each person getting what they wanted to drink with dinner. To sum this up, I like to vote with my money and my feet. So my feet will not be taking me back to Bellino, and my money will not be spent there. Understand that I like trying new experiences, and I am not against spending money. I just expect to get what I pay for. Good luck Bellino, you may need it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Friday night at Pizza Bellino

x9-_2YgsiC2hpmiJVSi2Jg.text: 1.5 but I rounded up for late night fast delivery. I've ordered from this place based upon Yelper's pretty good reviews, however, this was another time to remind myself to "BELIEVE NOBODY BUT ME" meaning the food pretty sucked. Yeyyy, that's right. SUCKED! BAD!  Small personal pizza- omg... it's beyond my vocabulary to describe... simply sucked. My food rarely goes into the trash but this time, it did.  Baked Ziti- again, basically the same tomato sauce and cheese as the pizza. Result in, SUCKED!  French fries- not the type I liked. Skinned and mush. I prefer crispy ones.  BBQ wings- ummmm.... they were soso... ok... didn't suck that as much as pizza and pasta did.  The best think was the side salad that came with pasta. It was fresh!

0YzcFa4k9flQm-OyXhUsqA.text: This is what we order when we deliver.  If Aiello's or Sola delivered, I'd never give this place a thought.  But it's pretty decent American delivery pizza.  If you wanna order some pizza delivery, get this.  If you want to go to the pizza, Aiello's, Sola, or Pizzaiolo will do you right.

arUI5kTaUvgkJEOKkQ-AlQ.text: We've gotten pizza take out a few times and the pizza was good. However, on our most recent visit, service was poor. Keep in mind this is a very casual pizza place - you order at the counter.  We had five adults and six kids so they would have had a nice order. There was only one couple in the restaurant, seated by the window. They did not seem to mind that there were families in what should have been a family restaurant.  However, when we went to order, and our kids were seated but yes, being kids excited to be with friends, they were laughing and having fun, the owner told us that our kids could not disturb the customers (again two people who were not looking over and likely had the impression that kids were welcome). We were stunned. Kids were not obnoxious (which bugs me even w/ my own kids but whatever if you're at a very casual place). So we left and went to Jimmy Johns and owner lost $100 of business for very silly reason.

ZHLKLJmzS_50oFEhAFOhJg.text: I am slightly confused by the reviews for Pizza Bellino, as they range from thrilled to enraged.  Pizza Bellino is one of the closer pizza places to my apartment, but I just made it here recently.  I stopped in because I was starving, and they sell single slices for $2.  I got a great slice of cheese pizza!  One slice was enough for a small meal, and the sauce is very nicely spiced.  The cheese quality is good too.  The service is pretty fast when you eat in, unlike Aiello's and Mineo's.  I have always had good customer service here as well.  There are crazy good lunch specials, and they always have deals in the Squirrel Hill Pennysaver.  As one of the only places that delivers in Squirrel Hill, I can imagine it can be pretty slow and tense.  I would stick to eat-in.  Good for a quick slice of pizza!

snKHtzeFI4OJGPBBr7TJhg.text: Ate their "food" once and learned my lesson. Never again. A few friends and myself got delivery, we ordered a pepperoni pizza, steak hoagies, popcorn shrimp and chicken fingers. The chicken tasted like the shrimp, so they clearly use the same oil (ew). The cheesesteaks were nothing more than the steak-ums you buy at the grocery store. No flavor, very little cheese and browning lettuce. The pizza is subpar at best; and with Mineo's and Aiello's just up the road you'd think they'd want to at least try and compete. It's a cheap knock off of a real pizza place. I know the other two don't deliver, and maybe that's what keeps this place afloat (or the drunks who order delivery because they can't drive and therefor can't taste the food either), but I'd rather drive and attempt to find parking on Murray Ave before I ever give this place another dollar. I'd give zero stars if I could...

mSz_NKOx8WbkXLelBgnNvQ.text: Best Cheese slice. I go once a week and simply enjoy the perfect proportion of cheese and tomato base

QhsI8FLRFdHYX3eQXruXfw.text: Lunchtime in Oakland can be a daunting task.  Options are immense here.  When you factor in if there is delivery or not, the number dwindles down some.  While hungry on this particular lunchtime, my coworkers and I decided to try something a little different than what they usually get (thank heavens for that).  After riffling through the menus they had stashed at work, they came upon Bellino's menu.  After looking it over, and tired from pizza and hoagies, I decided to go with a salad.  Not a bad choice to make.    Unlike your typical pizza place salad, this one actually made me feel full.  Maybe it was because of instead of using iceberg lettuce, they went with the mixed greens as the base.  And unlike other pizza places, they actually gave you some good toppings.  cucumbers, green peppers, grape tomatoes, and carrots.  I would have been satisfied if I would have just gotten a regular salad with those toppings.  However I did opt for the popcorn chicken salad which basically voided my healthy eating for the day.  With all the good for you toppings, they added the popcorn chicken, a ton of cheese and french fries (hey, they are still a vegetable ;)).  Overall, I liked it.  It hit the spot and I wasn't craving anything by the end of my shift at work.  I would definitely give Pizza Bellino a spot in my folder for their menu.

oJ1wcNPvENfeH6QbGti6nQ.text: Really good calzones (I got the Mediterranean). There was an amazing amount of cheese, and it was deliciously cooked. The cheesecake was frozen, but still pretty good. It was pretty reasonably priced, and delivery was very quick.

rGbK8EskArasrm4YBRAV2g.text: I dont normally write reviews, but Pizza Bellino is the truth!!    Food: My go-to would have to be the basic large cheese pizza, but by no means is it basic.  The crust is pleasantly crispy but not too thin.  the cheese is melty and perfectly browned.  Last but definitely not least, the sauce...oh, the delicious, homemade sauce! Im super picky about red sauce and I got no bones to pick w theirs. A large is usually enough for 3-4 people, or 2 people if you want some for tomorrow.    Service: Quick, food came hot, friendly delivery guy. What more can you really ask for?  I really don't get these bad reviews...this has been me and my workplaces fav for a while now...just stick with any of the pizzas (the broccoli one isn't amazing...get bbq chicken if u want specialty!) and gyros!! Gyros and pizzas are their sweet spot --I mean it IS a pizza place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummmy large chz pizza from Pizza Bellino

2pIC-_4qXOVYuNVIkxJchA.text: Solid late-night pepperoni pizza. This was the only pizza place willing to deliver at midnight during a snowstorm. Desperate times, but not a bad pizza.

juoqF1bQbWdq95fkoaBTag.text: First time I order. from Pizza Bellino, Large buffalo  chicken pizza and 12 fresh wings with mild sauce was tasty driver was very polite as well

qP9jPnZqKUubDlikpEcoGw.text: Poor food quality. The pepperoni on the pizza was burnt. Very bad mannered arab at the front counter. Also talking down to his poor employees. They should pick up their overall service if they want to remain competitive. Not worth it with so many other pizza places in sq. Hill.

ff7fqT5D-XfhZs3JLdaTkA.text: Walking through Squirrel hill alone and looking for a quick bite. Have always seen this place but never stopped in. Everything you need and expect - cheap, fast, clean, and delicious. 2 slices and a soda for under 5 bucks? Deal

4fCLSTr-O2W1SvUdQaVCvA.text: I ordered a large white sauce pizza from them on GrubHub not even two hours ago. My roommate and I had gone outside to wait on the pizza when it got closer to the arrival time. When it never came, I called the restaurant just to see how much longer it would be until the driver arrived. The guy who answered the phone (I'm assuming the manager) immediately started yelling at me and telling me it was my fault. When I tried to tell him I wasn't mad he was late, I just wanted to know how much longer it would be, he began berating me and telling me that I need to learn how to answer a phone. I tried to tell him I had my phone on me and that I had been sitting outside but he wouldn't even let me get three words out. He was screaming so loudly that I couldn't even understand half of what he was saying. He then said "he'll get there when he gets there" and hung up.  When the pizza finally arrived (I was honestly surprised that it did) it was horrible. It was cold and tasted like it had been sitting outside for hours. Plus, it was very rubbery and hard to chew.   PS just a shoutout to GrubHub.. I called about the issue and they're taking care of it.

BLVyU6izF-h7pRBXPoxD3w.text: I ordered the hot whole fresh wings after an intense study session late at night. The wings had no flavor and the hot sauce wasn't flavorful either. The wings were also super dry. Perhaps the normal wings are better but the wings I ordered were terrible.

De-4dzPutjLVQxVXYuYNxA.text: Excellent pizza and hoagie.  I had a large pepperoni pizza.  I like the pepperoni slices to be slightly charred and these were.  The cheese portion is standard which is how I prefer it.  I thought they did a good job with their crust.  I'd prefer a bit more crust myself, but the rest of the group liked it.  The Italian hoagie was nicely balanced between meat, cheese, and bread and toasted nicely.  It was a vinegar and oil based Italian dressing, not the creamy Italian that some places use for some reason.

s_K4kQs91r7m1soGNcw-Kw.text: So, after trying a number of different pizza/wing/junk food places on GrubHub and not finding many to be consistent or yummy, we decided to try Pizza Bellino.  Some of the supposed "better" pizza places in the area we live are not open on Sunday afternoons leaving us few options either A) for delivery or B) just to eat!    We got wings and a chicken parm hoagie... both were good, but nothing spectacular or over the top.  They get brownie points for being fast and efficient though.  The food was actually fresh and hot when it got here... the hoagie was not soggy like they can often be when too much time elapses before it gets to you.  I would definitely order from here again... good basics with good service in a timely fashion makes it worth trying.

awgCr2m-oSwhH2_4OZyR9Q.text: I just had a delivery from here tonight and the hoagie and poppers i got were amazing.

Ednv2yEvM-wgx4hVM2l62Q.text: Ordered a pizza, "broccoli bites" and cheesecake.  It was terrible.  The pizza was so bland we wished we had ordered from Dominos and the cheesecake was FROZEN. Terrible, all around.  *Update: They did refund me for the terrible pizza (though not the cheesecake--whatever on that...) so I give them credit for that. I still would not order from them again.  Another good note, the driver was extremely pleasant and was surprised that I tipped him.  Refreshing service in that sense.  For that reason, I have upgraded to two stars.

vq7ztYhf2LpIacAdYXwTug.text: Great great service.  I ordered from yelp and the food was delivered in less than 45 minutes.  Pizza-was ok.  The salad was on point and the wings are good too. Dressing was warm but overall I'd order here again

hG2s7CFiBdpubhzv_lllWw.text: Ordered a large garden salad and the buffalo chicken salad, both were delicious.  Salads were huge, I had the buffalo, the chicken was super spicy and delicious. Fresh crisp vegetables, great pizza place salad for sure.  Also ordered breadsticks which were probably some of the best I've ever had, very doughy and the perfect amount of flavor.  Delivery was fast, will absolutely be ordering again.

Xkm5KgJOknG4HRt4uwu2Cg.text: The manager was very rude to me over the phone because my order had a hair in it and I was upset he called me racial slurs I tried should get a a new no salad he said it was my fault

lXTYvb9KcL2mutQkgxJc8A.text: Pizza Bellino is a place I dedicate to when I feel like I simply cannot have enough carbs. I am not going to say the food is incredible, although it is good. The best thing about Bellino is they have amazing crust and breads. A personal pan pizza is cheap and very filling. They don't do anything particular with their sauce or cheese, so it stays mild and consistent. But their crust is always amazing! Their breadsticks are always amazing!! They make their own dough, and it shows. The breadsticks are puffed perfectly, and chewy, covered with parm and garlic sauce. People usually get really excited about olive garden breadsticks, but I am here to say that these are 10 times better.   They have a vast menu, and the owner is always there. I do sometimes wish they would switch out their flourescent bulbs in the dining area. But definitely give Pizza Bellino a try, I think it will happily surprise you!

N8kK_8-RW4MOhHoTNQgpug.text: This place is the worst, I went in there to get a pizza and the cashier yelled "bancode" at me because I told him my pizza was burnt.

dscbdwB04bj8ohi7QC63dQ.text: This pizza was probably one of the worst pizzas I've ever had, no flavor in dough, pizza sauce, even the pepperoni!! Would not recommend to pizza lovers. hope this helps someone

ZQdDPsr1yUwQTnLxTWLxuA.text: The customer service is horrible. We were charged over $23 for a deal that was listed online as $17.99. I showed him my phone to show that the price listed online was $17.99. He said the online prices were not updated and proceeded to pull out a menu and show me the new price. He was unapologetic and did not offer to honor the price that he had failed to update online.   Pizza really is great but customer service is bad enough that I won't go back.

snB_Px2zsrAIW6n9MgdacQ.text: This may have been the worst chicken parm I've ever had. The chicken was cut up in small pieces and tasted like Perdue chicken nuggets that were chewy and soggy. The cheese was burnt. Terrible. Two stars because I ordered their pizza before and liked it. Figured their other dishes would be good but I was very wrong!

lfk4CGGn4ibz-3NXImtVHA.text: Delivery was FAST. White pizza was delicious - great crust. Eggplant Parm hoagie was meh they put like one piece of eggplant on it and some generic red sauce. Fries were good, they just needed salt. Basically the food is average and if you're hungover/need a quick bite this is a good place to stop by

Ja-fgSbURF_OkdrLmwQawQ.text: Back when I lived in Pittsburgh I would come in here once a week for their lunch special. The pizza has always been good but the service not so much. So this weekend I am visiting Pittsburgh and decided to stop back in and nothing has changed. The pizza is still decent enough to put up with the lack of customer service. To start, when approaching the cash register the employee did not say hello or even what would you like. It was literally a staring session for a few seconds with no dialogue when he approached the register.     I broke the ice and this is how the convo went.  Me: I would like two Pepperoni slices please Him: With drink? Me: No thank you Him: *Sticks hand out for my credit card* Me: Well what's the total? Him: with no drink, $5. Turns walks away and tells them the order. Me: Okayyyyy  Like I said, not the worst but just not very inviting.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ncGx8HaUcBX7GUBc7Vwcig.text: This was one of my favorite places to eat but the delivery driver ruined everything he was very rude and demanded a tip I've also instructed all staff in my building not to order from here any more

Pp50DkJ-SELzkJKrvBgE-Q.text: This is my first time ordering from Pizza Bellino. I ordered a white pizza and garlic wings. The delivery was timely, slightly earlier than expected. The food was basically average. It may be because I grew up on Mineo's and Caruso's and now called A'Pizza Badamo. The pizza wasn't cold but it wasn't hot either. The wings were a similar temperature. They were crispy, juicy, and well cooked. The garlic sauce was rather bland and left a lot to be desired.

Rk9BEmxH4Lg0Fw5xvYECbg.text: Food is always good. They could probably stand to make the crust a little lighter with less sauce but overall their salads and pizza is pretty good.

UUT5S6Ysc0ce9TjEpVejWQ.text: Their delivery white pizza with ricotta and spinach is my go-to. The crust is so delicious, crispy and buttery. Lunch specials and sandwiches are great for eating in. The supreme buffalo chicken sub is very good. They also have super good slices and you can get nice toppings too. Very fresh! The slices get topped with toppings and then into the oven so they come out really crispy and delish!  The staff is always nice and very welcoming and the location is great. There are very few good delivery options in squirrel hill besides Chinese/Asian so I call Pizza Bellino when I don't want to go out.  The delivery is super super quick and always shows up piping hot. The sandwiches are not the best delivered but what hot sandwich is good if it's not as fresh as possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu of specials!

F_pY1SpYEyBdQiXIHEwfwQ.text: Just delicious!Amazing pizza. Hawaii pizza is really good!The delivery was fast and pizza was still hot.

bbMcyB0p5Ud2sBN_FWJPTA.text: I was looking forward to trying the white pizza with spinach and ricotta as recommended in another review i saw, but the menu was a little misleading.  I placed my order online and, while browsing the menu, I saw an option for a white pizza with spinach, ricotta, tomato, and mushrooms OR a traditional white pizza (with no ingredients or description listed.)  I thought perhaps the traditional white pizza came with spinach and ricotta (as some white pizzas at other restaurants do) but I was disappointed to find that it was just a regular cheese pizza sans sauce.  I expressed my disappointment to the man working and he was unhelpful- he merely informed me that i had ordered incorrectly and didn't offer any solutions, so i left with my pizza.  It was pretty bland and greasy but it was ok.. I mean, even bad pizza is still good.. right??

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

z064r7Ki06cmxd7ng8xZ_Q.text: Needed to order lunch and didn't have time to pick up pizza. Found them via Grubhub with over 1,000 reviews and highly rated. I order a pepperoni pizza, it was your average run of the mill pizza. Not bad but there's many other better pizza places.

6R8ioT6iUuQxcTZ68-kycQ.text: Absolutely terrible.  Cold, not marked and the owner was the rudest person I have ever spent my money with...STAY AWAY

IyOWtaPzWX4xXj9ESF7M-Q.text: If I could, I would give this restaurant zero stars. My friend ordered food from them through grubhub wile we were hanging out - popcorn chicken and buffalo fries- but upon arrival,  my friend received chicken tenders instead. No big deal, but the hot food came in Styrofoam containers, and because they were stacked, the packed heat melted the containers into/onto the food. They tried a bite of the chicken and it tasted distinctly like Styrofoam. They proceeded to be violently ill for the rest of the evening. When i came back after class, we tried calling,  but the man who answered was HORRENDOUS. We politely asked for a full refund of the food we didn't eat,and were told that we had not ordered from them at all. We had to repeat ourselves several times to establish the fact that yes, we did order this food, we had the order in front of us.  He then said that the containers don't melt. Well, this picture of the container I have says otherwise.  He continously interrupted us over the phone, berated us for yelling at him (which we didn't do, we simply asked for a refund and stated why), and when he was fed up told us that it was grubhub's problem instead and refused to accept any responsibility. Honestly, if he would have just been polite and directed us to grub hub in the first place,  this wouldn't be an issue,  but because of his behavior,  we will no longer be ordering from this establishment again. On top of that, it would probably even be cheaper and more environmentally friendly if they'd just  switched to cardboard containers. Not to mention, no one would get sick.  Tldr; melted Styrofoam made my friend sick, worst customer service we've had in years.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Bellino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZEPDkFKmSc-1I6YKpwydrA.text: I ordered Bellino's through Eat Street. They sent the wrong soup, so I called Bellino's to get the correct soup sent. The man answered the phone and I nicely told him I recieved the wrong soup. Not even a second later he is screaming at me how I'm a "stupid idiot" for not calling to see what the soup was. I told him that I ordered through Eat Street and the soup I ordered was an option on the menu. He then said that both Eat Street and I are "stupid idiots" and me getting the wrong soup is my and Eat Streets fault and I got what I'm getting that's it. I asked him why he was treating a customer so rudely and he cussed at me. I then asked him if I couldn't have the potato soup then why was it on the receipt and why would they just automatically send me wedding soup? And why is it my job to call them if they don't have the soup I ordered, why wouldn't they call me and ask? He screamed at me that am a spoiled, worthless American and should ___ __! He then hung up on me. I called Eat Street and told them what happened and they were so appalled that they refunded my money and sent me a coupon for my next order through Eat Street. Thank goodness Eat Street knows how to treat their customers. I only called this man to get the correct soup, if he just said "We're sorry, we don't have it." this would have all been over and I would've been fine but he was so terribly ignorant and rude to me, that they lost a very good cutomer today and possibly lost their membership to Eat Street. Do yourself a favor and don't ever order from here, it turned my great day into a headache.

4y0n9RhAzJVL1_w4WMbzUg.text: A very big menu and quick service. I stop here for my later lunch hour on weekdays. Really good if you want something for in and out eating. If you get more complex than a pie or couple slices, you might want to order ahead of time so you don't have to wait too long.

yQ37UIHVr-3NNn6lWUbkzQ.text: I absolutely love Bellino's pizza and subs. The variety of pizzas is incredible and as a fan of their veggie it is huge and packed with flavor. The subs are large and filled with your favorites. Highly recommend Bellino's, very highly.

J2Whk-b216S4wp5zxIVNdQ.text: Be aware of the terrible customer service! Not only was our food late (30+ minutes) but the man answering the phone was EXTREMELY hostile. When I had inquired about our delivery he barely let me speak and when I had attempted to ask a question, he threw a vague answer at me and then hung up. I placed my order through EAT24, to whom of which, could barely handle the dilemma. Pizza Bellino refused to give me a refund and offered to deliver the old pizza instead (at that point 50+ minutes old). EAT24 ended up refunding me however, I would think twice about both companies before doing anymore business with either one. Pittsburgh has tons of great pizza places I will never order from this rat hole again.
